intro: Graffenrieda santamartensis, commonly known as the Santa Marta false arum, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, spatulate leaves and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a distinctive spathe that resembles an arum. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
